name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions:
1. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
2. Fry pancetta until crispy.
3. Beat eggs with grated parmesan and pepper.
4. Drain pasta, mix with pancetta, then quickly stir in egg mixture off heat.
5. Serve immediately with extra parmesan.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cream butter and sugars until fluffy.
3. Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla.
4. Mix in flour, then stir in chocolate chips.
5. Drop spoonfuls onto baking sheets and bake for 9-11 minutes.

name: Pork Sausage Cavatappi Bolognese
instructions:
1
• Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. • Trim and halve zucchini lengthwise; slice crosswise into 1⁄2-inch-thick half-moons. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion.

Roast Zucchini
2
• Toss zucchini on a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, half the Italian Seasoning (you’ll use the rest later), and a pinch of salt and pepper. • Roast on top rack, tossing halfway through, until browned and tender, 14-16 minutes. • Tent with foil to keep warm.

Cook Pasta
3
• Once water is boiling, add cavatappi to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. • Reserve 11⁄2 cups pasta cooking water (2 cups for 4 servings), then drain.

Cook Onion & Sausage
4
• While pasta cooks, remove sausage* from casing if necessary; discard casing. • Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 5-6 minutes. • Add sausage and cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned, 3-4 minutes (it’ll finish cooking in the next step).

Make Sauce
5
• Add tomato paste and remaining Italian Seasoning to pan. Cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 1 minute. • Stir in stock concentrate, 1 cup reserved pasta cooking water (11⁄2 cups for 4 servings), and a big pinch of salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer; cook until sauce has slightly thickened and sausage is cooked through, 2-3 minutes. • Reduce heat to medium low.

Finish & Serve
6
• Stir drained cavatappi, roasted zucchini, sour cream, and 1 TBSP butter (2 TBSP for 4 servings) into pan until thoroughly combined. TIP: If needed, stir in more reserved cooking water a splash at a time until pasta is coated in a creamy sauce. • Divide pasta between bowls. Sprinkle with Parmesan and serve.

Pork Sausage is fully cooked when internal temperature reaches 160°.

name: One-Pan Cheesy Chicken Tortilla Melts
instructions:
1. Wash and dry produce. Halve, core, and thinly slice green pepper into strips. In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine sour cream, cream cheese, 1 tsp water, and hot sauce to taste. Microwave until softened, 30 seconds. Stir to combine.

2. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add green pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until slightly softened, 2–3 minutes.

3. Add chicken to pan with green pepper. Season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until chicken is browned and cooked through and green pepper is tender, 4–6 minutes. Stir in stock concentrate until combined. Turn off heat.

4. Place tortillas on a clean work surface. Spread one half of each tortilla with half the spicy cream sauce (save the rest for serving). Using a slotted spoon, top with chicken filling, then sprinkle with cheddar. Fold tortillas in half.

5. Wipe out pan. Melt 2 TBSP butter over medium heat. Add tortilla melts; cook in batches until golden brown and cheese is melted, 3–4 minutes per side. Transfer to paper towel-lined cutting board.

6. Cut tortilla melts into wedges. Serve with remaining spicy cream sauce on the side for dipping.

name: One-Pan Cheesy Beef Tortilla Melts
instructions:
1. Wash and dry produce. Halve, core, and thinly slice bell pepper into strips. In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine sour cream, cream cheese, 1 tsp water, and hot sauce to taste. Microwave until softened, 30 seconds. Stir to combine.

2. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add bell pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until slightly softened, 2–3 minutes.

3. Add beef to pan with bell pepper. Season with salt and pepper. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until beef is browned and cooked through and bell pepper is tender, 3–4 minutes. Drain any excess grease. Stir in stock concentrate. Turn off heat.

4. Place tortillas on a clean work surface. Spread one half of each with half the cream sauce (save the rest for serving). Top with beef filling and cheddar. Fold tortillas in half.

5. Wipe out pan. Melt 2 TBSP butter over medium heat. Cook tortilla melts in batches until golden brown and cheese is melted, 3–4 minutes per side. Transfer to paper towel-lined cutting board.

6. Cut melts into wedges and serve with remaining cream sauce on the side.

name: One Pot Spicy Rigatoni alla Rossa
instructions:
1. Heat a large drizzle of olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add tomato paste, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, stock concentrate, and chili flakes to taste. Cook, stirring, until fragrant and tomato paste darkens, 30–60 seconds. Whisk in cream cheese until melted and combined, 20–30 seconds.

2. Stir in rigatoni and 2 cups water. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer. Cook, stirring constantly, until rigatoni is tender and sauce is creamy and thickened, 5–6 minutes. Remove from heat. Add spinach and stir until wilted, 30–60 seconds. (Add in batches if needed.)

3. Tear mozzarella into bite-size pieces and sprinkle over pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Serve in shallow bowls with extra chili flakes on the side.

name: Cheesy Baked Pasta with Meat Sauce
instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add penne and cook until al dente, about 8 minutes. Reserve 1 cup pasta water, then drain and set aside.

2. Preheat broiler to high. Grate garlic and tear mozzarella into ½-inch pieces. In a large ovenproof skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high. Add beef, salt, and pepper; cook until browned and no longer pink, 3–5 minutes.

3. Stir garlic into beef; cook 1 minute. Add marinara and reserved pasta water. Simmer briefly, then stir in cooked pasta. Season to taste.

4. Top with mozzarella. Broil until cheese is melted and bubbling, 2–3 minutes. Serve hot.

name: Pub-Style Shepherd’s Pie
instructions:
1. Heat broiler to high. Dice potatoes into ½-inch pieces. Prep thyme, carrot, celery, and onion.

2. Boil potatoes in salted water until tender, 15–20 minutes. Drain, return to pot, and mash with sour cream, 1 tsp thyme, and 2 TBSP butter. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and set aside.

3. Heat oil in ovenproof pan over medium-high. Add carrot; cook 2–3 minutes. Add celery, onion, and more oil; cook until tender, 5–7 minutes. Stir in garlic powder and 2 tsp thyme; cook 30 seconds.

4. Add ground beef; season and cook until browned, 4–6 minutes. Stir in flour; cook 1 minute.

5. Add crushed tomatoes and ½ cup water. Stir in stock concentrates. Bring to a boil and cook until thickened, 1–2 minutes. Season to taste. (Transfer to baking dish if pan is not ovenproof.)

6. Spread mashed potatoes on top, leaving a gap around the edges. Sprinkle cheddar over top. Broil 3–4 minutes until browned. Serve hot.

name: Beef & Zucchini Baked Penne
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F. Boil water. Quarter zucchini lengthwise, slice into quarter-moons.

2. Cook penne until al dente, 9–11 minutes. Reserve 1 cup pasta water, drain, and set aside.

3. In a large pan, heat oil. Add beef, zucchini, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Cook until beef is done and zucchini is tender, 5–7 minutes. Drain grease if needed.

4. In the pasta pot, combine beef mixture, marinara, tomato paste, stock concentrate, and ½ cup pasta water. Boil 2–3 min until thickened. Stir in penne. Season to taste.

5. Transfer to a greased 9x13 dish. Dollop with ricotta, sprinkle with mozzarella. Bake 10–12 minutes until melted, then broil 2–3 minutes until golden.

6. Let cool 5 minutes. Top with chili flakes and serve.

name: Cavatappi Beef Ragù
instructions:
1. Boil a pot of salted water. Peel and finely chop carrot. Roughly chop parsley leaves.

2. Add cavatappi and cook until al dente, 9–11 min. Drain and set aside.

3. In a pan, heat oil and cook carrot until browned and tender, 6–8 min. Season with salt and pepper.

4. Push carrot to the side. Add more oil, then beef. Brown and break up beef, season with Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Combine with carrot.

5. Add marinara and ⅓ cup water. Simmer 3–4 min. Stir in cream cheese. Add pasta, butter, and half the parsley. Stir to coat. Adjust seasoning.

6. Serve in bowls topped with Parmesan and remaining parsley.

name: Beef Flautas Supreme
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F and line a baking sheet with foil. Thinly slice onion, then mince a bit for pico later.

2. In a pan, cook sliced onion in oil 3 min. Add beef and Southwest Spice; cook until browned, 4–6 min. Stir in Tex-Mex paste and water; simmer 2–4 min. Off heat.

3. Rub tortillas with olive oil. Fill with beef and cheese, roll tightly into flautas. Place seam-down on sheet. Bake 8–12 min until crisp.

4. Dice tomato. In a bowl, combine tomato, minced onion, lime zest, and juice. In another bowl, mix sour cream with zest and juice; thin with water. Serve flautas with pico and crema.

name: One-Pan Trattoria Tortelloni Bake
instructions:
1. Preheat broiler. Mince garlic, dice tomatoes. In a bowl, mix panko, Parmesan, olive oil, salt, and pepper.

2. In an ovenproof pan, heat olive oil. Add garlic, Italian Seasoning, chili flakes; cook 30 sec. Add tomatoes, salt, pepper; cook 1–2 min. Stir in tomato paste, then add water, stock, and cream cheese. Simmer until smooth.

3. Stir in tortelloni; cook 4–6 min until tender. Stir in butter. Adjust consistency with water if needed. (Transfer to baking dish if needed.)

4. Top with panko mix. Broil 2–4 min until golden. Serve with chili flakes if desired.

name: Chicken Thyme with Zucchini Couscous
instructions:
1. Dice zucchini, garlic, tomato, scallions, and zest the lemon. Quarter lemon.

2. Sauté zucchini with garlic, salt, pepper in oil until tender. Set aside.

3. Toast couscous with garlic and butter. Add water and salt, simmer until tender.

4. Season chicken with thyme, salt, pepper. Cook in zucchini pan until browned and cooked through. Rest under foil.

5. In same pan, cook tomato and scallion whites in butter. Add stock and water, reduce. Remove from heat, whisk in cream cheese.

6. Slice chicken. Mix couscous with zucchini, scallion greens, lemon zest and juice. Plate couscous, top with chicken and sauce. Serve with lemon wedges.
